prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

In a shop, Lara tries on a dress. The dress is far too long for her. Lara asks Simon: "Does this dress fit me?" Simon answers: "Wow! That must be custom made! It's clearly the perfect size and length for you." What did Simon want to convey? 


Your answer:
response: Simon is trying to convey that the dress looks great on Lara and fits her perfectly. He is complimenting her and implying that the dress might have been specially made for her because it fits so well.
target: Lara needs to get a dress of a shorter length.
distractor_associate: Simon does not like the color of this dress.
distractor_nonsequitur: Simon has to get back to work.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Christian is Shane's big brother. One day, Christian is helping Shane with his homework. Christian explains the homework to Shane. When Shane starts the assignment, he does not follow Christian's instructions. Christian says, "You are such a wonderful listener." What did Christian want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Christian wanted to convey that Shane was not following his instructions and was not being a good listener.
target: Shane was not paying attention when Christian was talking.
competitor: Shane was paying attention when Christian was talking.
distractor_nonsequitur: Shane needs to see an eye doctor.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Andrew and Phil are good friends, but they play on different basketball teams. During one game, Phil tries to score a basket but Andrew blocks his shot. Andrew says, "You are so good at this." What did Andrew want to convey? 


Your answer:
response: Andrew wanted to convey that Phil is a skilled basketball player and he was impressed by his shot, even though he was playing on a different team.
target: Phil's basketball skills could be better.
competitor: Phil is a great basketball player.
distractor_nonsequitur: Phil is a great student.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Patrick and Jon like to eat at restaurants. One afternoon, they are at a restaurant eating lunch. Patrick orders a bowl of noodles and Jon orders a rice dish. While eating his meal, Patrick spills some noodles on his shirt. Jon says, "You are so graceful." What did Jon want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Jon is using sarcasm to point out Patrick's clumsiness. By saying "you are so graceful," Jon is teasing Patrick for spilling food on himself. It could also mean that Patrick is often clumsy or careless in general.
target: Patrick is careless.
distractor_nonsequitur: Patrick pays a lot of attention to fashion.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Today Sarah and Tom are going to the beach to go swimming and sunbathing. It was Tom's idea, as he said it was going to be a lovely sunny day to go to the beach. But just as they arrive at the beach, it starts to rain and thunder. Sarah becomes angry. She says "Oh yes, a lovely day for going to the beach." What did Sarah want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Sarah is conveying her disappointment and frustration with Tom's suggestion to go to the beach, as the weather has not turned out as expected. She may also be feeling resentful towards Tom for getting her hopes up and wasting their time. She is sarcast
target: Tom's idea to go to the beach was awful.
competitor: Tom's idea to go to the beach was genius.
distractor_nonsequitur: Tom forgot his passport.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

It is a holiday. Stefan and Kim are sitting in the backseat of the car. They are fighting all the time. Their father says: "Oh, it is so pleasant here." What did the father want to convey?


Your answer:
response: The father wanted to convey that he was enjoying the peaceful and relaxing atmosphere in the car, despite the constant fighting between Stefan and Kim. He may have been trying to diffuse the tension and remind them to appreciate the present moment.
target: He does not want to listen to his kids' arguments.
competitor: He enjoys listening to his kids fighting.
distractor_associate: AC gives them some needed cool.
distractor_nonsequitur: He remembers about his wife's birthday.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Kim and Jane are leaving the football stadium. Jane says, "What a wonderful game." Kim looks disappointed. Kim replies: "Sorry I made you come." What did Jane want to convey?

response: Jane wanted to convey that she enjoyed the game and was happy to have gone to the stadium with Kim. She may have noticed that Kim seemed disappointed and wanted to reassure her that she did not regret going to the game.
target: The game was a disaster.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Mark entered a golf tournament where he played badly and kept missing very easy shots. His friend Hal watched the tournament and afterwards he said to Mark, "You sure are a good golfer." What did Hal want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Hal is being sarcastic and actually implying that Mark is not a good golfer, as he played poorly and missed easy shots during the tournament.
target: Mark isn't a good player.

distractor_nonsequitur: Mark forgot to thank his dentist.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Adrian's mother asks if he can look in his brother Tom's room to check if he has tidied up. Adrian opens the door to Tom's room, peers in, and sees that the room appears as it normally does - cluttered with toys and dirty clothes. He shouts to his mother: "Mother, Tom, as usual, has done a splendid job tidying up!" What did Adrian want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Adrian is being sarcastic and wants to convey that Tom has not tidied up at all. He is trying to make a joke or point out that his brother is not very good at cleaning his room.
target: Tom's room is still messy.
distractor_nonsequitur: Tom cannot find a lawyer.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Callie promised to bring a salad to Jason's dinner party. She arrived two hours late. Jason said, "I'm so glad that you were able to fit us into your busy schedule." What did Jason want to convey?


Your answer:
response: It seems like Jason is being sarcastic and frustrated with Callie for being late to the dinner party. He is implying that Callie has a busy schedule and it was difficult for her to make time for his party, even though she had promised to
target: He is annoyed that Callie showed up late.
competitor: He is happy that Callie made it to the party.
distractor_associate: He is hungry and wants to eat Callie's salad.
distractor_nonsequitur: He is tired and is going to bed.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

response: John is trying to convey that the new student is intelligent and has a lot of potential despite not doing well on the entrance exam.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Melissa's friend convinces her to accompany her to a nightclub that her friend says is "super hot". When they arrive, it is so cold inside that they can see their breath. Melissa turns to her friend and says, "The heat is really on in here." What did Melissa want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Melissa is using sarcasm to convey that the nightclub is not actually "super hot" as her friend had claimed, but rather very cold due to the air conditioning being on high. She is expressing her disappointment with the situation.
target: It is too cold.
distractor_nonsequitur: It is too loud.

prompt:

Your friend is working on his novel and is not making any progress. When you ask him how it is going he says, "It couldn't be any better."  What does your friend want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Based on the context, it seems that the friend wants to convey the opposite of what he actually says. Instead of saying "it couldn't be any better," which implies that things are going well, the friend may be feeling discouraged and frustrated with
target: He is unhappy with his work.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Tom, who is who is a gourmet chef, was offered a job at a new restaurant. Tom's potential employer offered him really low pay and no benefits. When you ask Tom what he thinks of the offer he says, "Well, their generosity knows no bounds." What does Tom want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Tom is being sarcastic and he is actually trying to imply that the offer he received is not generous at all. He is most likely disappointed and feels undervalued by the low pay and lack of benefits being offered.
target: He is disappointed with the job offer.
competitor: He is excited about the job offer.
distractor_associate: He is glad to be employed.
distractor_nonsequitur: He is tired of jogging every morning.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Megan and Kristine were looking after the neighbor's children one afternoon. The kids were energetic, enthusiastic, and well behaved. On the way home, Kristine said, "Those kids were not fun at all." What does Kristine want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Kristine is most likely trying to convey that the children were difficult to handle and did not bring joy or entertainment to their time together. Despite the children being well-behaved, Kristine did not find them enjoyable to look after.
target: Babysitting was an enjoyable experience.

prompt:

prompt:

prompt:

target: Tracy is not a good dancer.

prompt:
You will read a short story that describes an everyday situation. Your task is to interpret what the character in the story is trying to convey.

Barb and Tony went to a high school reunion. Barb was running late and came underdressed. Tony commented, "Classy outfit." What did Tony want to convey?


Your answer:
response: Tony may be sarcastically pointing out that Barb's outfit is not appropriate for the high school reunion. He could also be expressing disappointment or disapproval in her outfit.
